intro: Dicoma anomala subsp. attenuata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dicoma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
